newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian bullion markets closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian bullion markets closed for holiday.

text.p: Indian bullion markets were closed on Wednesday for a national holiday and will reopen on Thursday, dealers said.
They said gold prices on Tuesday eased amid sluggish physical buying and fresh offerings.
Gold biscuit (116.50 grammes) settled 100 rupees lower at 59,700 rupees per piece.
Silver opened lower on the back of weak trend in the world market but held steady at that level throughout the day on stray industrial support, dealers said.
